DOC.brief_summary: We aim answer clinical question : Does combine spinal-epidural analgesia improve success rate external cephalic version ? We hypothesize neuraxial analgesia ( spinal epidural analgesia ) version breech presentation increase successful fetal rotation decrease incidence Cesarean delivery malpresentation .
DOC.brief_title: The Effect Combined Spinal-Epidural Analgesia Success External Cephalic Version ( ECV ) Breech Position
DOC.detailed_description: At term 2 3 % singleton pregnancy breech presentation . Many delivery manage cesarean delivery due high neonatal morbidity associate vaginal breech delivery . Cesarean delivery , safe option baby , however , associate high incidence maternal complication current subsequent pregnancy . External cephalic version procedure commonly use attempt manually rotate fetus vertex position . This facilitate vaginal delivery thus avoid high maternal and/or neonatal complication . Obstetricians perform version 36 week gestational age reportable success rate 30-80 % . The common technique involve external manipulation fetal position precede pharmacologic uterine relaxation . Pain relief commonly provide form intravenous opioids fentanyl . A efficacious form analgesia use neuraxial opioids local anesthetic ( neuraxial analgesia ) , technique commonly use labor delivery analgesia . Although use neuraxial analgesia anesthesia technique improve maternal pain satisfaction , conflict evidence improve success rate version procedure . The American College Obstetricians Gynecologists ( ACOG ) state , `` Currently enough evidence make recommendation favor oppose anesthesia ECV ( external cephalic version ) attempt . '' We propose conduct prospective , single blind , randomize clinical trial assess impact combine spinal-epidural analgesia success rate external version breech fetal position subsequent incidence vaginal vs. Cesarean delivery secondary outcome .
